hints.content:
To find how many $\goldE{\text{Elephants}}$ are in the circus, we start with how many $\blueE{\text{Horses}}$ there are and add $\maroonD{8}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc1b44a1de163af2e0cec35c301f582e41406f08)

$\blueE{7} + \maroonD{8} = \goldE{\Box}$

Let's add to find how many $\goldE{\text{Elephants}}$ are in the circus.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/988d0c4e3f4646cf98254fd7f54f96d2a1f2d921)

$\blueE{7} + \maroonD{8} = \goldE{15}$

question.content:
There are $7$ horses in the circus.

There are $8$ more elephants than horses in the circus.

**How many elephants are in the circus?**

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] elephants
